%c[ui_gray_1]The device is a home-made portable electricity generator with a manual drive. It is based on a single-phase asynchronous motor, from an old electrical appliance. The output voltage passes through a step-down transformer to the rectifier, assembled using Soviet Diodes D242 to the Portable Power Unit. Self-excitation of the generator occurs due to the capacitor connected to the auxiliary winding of the motor. The charge is performed by rotating the rotor through a worm gear at a nominal speed of 1300-1500 rpm. The device is equipped with an American-made point-turn ammeter, manufactured by WESTON ELECTRICAL INSTRUMENT. Due to its design, it has quite a lot of weight, but still very much appreciated in the Zone. Some craftsmen can refine this device.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]CHARACTERISTICS:
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] technological device
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] motor with rated power 40 W%c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] the lifetime of the motor and gearbox bearings is limited
%c[d_cyan]

Un lanzagranadas de cañón único, rifle y carga frontal, de un solo disparo, para rifles de asalto fabricados en los países del Pacto de Varsovia. Diseñado para expandir en gran medida el poder de fuego de un escuadrón de infantería básica. The firing mechanism is self-cocking, with a manual safety catch and automatic shot prevention if incorrectly installed onto a rifle.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] muzzle velocity: %c[ui_gray_1]~76 m / sec
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] fire range: %c[ui_gray_1]~300 m
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] reload time: %c[ui_gray_1]slow
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ammunition: %c[ui_gray_1]VOG-25 40mm grenade

Un lanzagranadas M203 modificado cuya longitud se ha reducido en tres pulgadas, y que se puede unir a las armas por medio de un raíl Picatinny. Gracias a un montaje modificado, este lanzagranadas es ampliamente utilizado en todo el mundo y se puede instalar en la mayoría de los rifles producidos actualmente. Although of more modern design, it has almost the same properties as its Soviet counterpart - the GP-25 grenade launcher.
 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] muzzle velocity: %c[ui_gray_1]~76 m / sec
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] fire range: %c[ui_gray_1]~300 m
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] reload time: %c[ui_gray_1]slow
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ammunition: %c[ui_gray_1]M203 40mm grenade

The 9A91 is a gas operated, rotating bolt weapon, which utilises a long stroke gas piston, located above the barrel, and a rotating bolt with 4 lugs. El receptor está hecho de estampados de acero, el mango delantero y el mango de pistola están hechos de polímero. El material de acero se pliega y arriba del receptor cuando no está en uso. The flip up rear sight has settings for 100 and 200 meters range, but the relatively short sight base and steep trajectory of the subsonic bullet restricts the 9A-91 to ranges of about 100 meters.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO, PSO-1M2-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 9A-91/VSK-94 suppressor

Una mejora clave de la AN-94 sobre la AK-74 es la introducción del modo de ráfaga adicional de 2 Munición. Nikonov design delays the force of recoil until the fired rounds have left the barrel, which along with a unique 1800 rpm two-shot burst function increases body armour piercing capabilities of this firearm. Used by Spetsnaz operators as well as Duty members to take out armoured targets at relatively long ranges.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes

The Galil ACE family is designed and produced by the Israeli arms company IWI Ltd. The basis of the ACE Galil rifles is the Galil assault rifle, which in its turn is based on Kalashnikov's AK rifle. El ACE de Galil se centra en la ergonomía, la facilidad de uso y la integración con accesorios adicionales, así como la flexibilidad en el combate: la familia Galil ACE incluye los tres tipos de munición más comunes del mundo (5.56x45 OTAN, 7.62x39 M43 y OTAN 7.62x51), con múltiples longitudes de barril para cada tipo. This particular variant utilises 5.56x45 NATO rounds and has a compact barrel. En la Zona, este rifle de asalto es una rareza.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ACCESORIOS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]Silenciador compatible con 5.56x45 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Miras ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech

Basado en rifles AK anteriores en diseño y disposición interna, el AEK-971 también está equipado con un mecanismo de equilibrio de retroceso, lo que resulta en un fuego automático más controlable. Pequeños lotes de este rifle fueron fabricados para el MVD ruso. Este modelo tiene específicamente un color beige claro con manchas rojas, simbolizando la facción Deber. Algunos mecanismos fueron reensamblados o reemplazados por otros más confiables. Las piezas están más ajustadas, lo que resulta en una mayor cadencia de tiro.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ACCESORIOS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Miras EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Silenciador TGP-A 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Lanzagranadas GP-25

Basado en rifles AK anteriores en diseño y disposición interna, el AEK-971 también está equipado con un mecanismo de equilibrio de retroceso, lo que resulta en un fuego automático más controlable. Pequeños lotes de este rifle fueron fabricados para el MVD ruso.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ACCESORIOS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]Miras EKP 1S-03 Kobra, 1P29, PSO- 1 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]Silenciador TGP-A 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2]Lanzagranadas GP-25

The AEK-973 is a 7.62x39mm version of AEK-971 developed at the Kovrov Mechanical Plant under the direction of Stanislav Ivanovich Koksharov based on SA-006 system. Based on previous AK rifles in internal design and layout, the AEK-973 is also equipped with a recoil-balancing mechanism, resulting in more controllable automatic fire. Small batches of this rifle were manufactured for the Russian MVD.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher

El AK-47 se puede describir como un híbrido de tecnología de rifle anterior. Mikhail Kalashnikov diseñó este rifle automático que combina las mejores características del American M1 y el alemán StG44. El Kalashnikov es un rifle de asalto operado por gas de 7.62x39 y, con mucho, el brazo pequeño más prolífico de la segunda mitad del siglo XX. It had been and still is, in more or less modified form, manufactured in dozens of countries and has been used in hundreds of conflicts since its introduction.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] PBS-1 suppressor
%c[d_red] • %c[d_red] None due to the absence of a dovetail mount
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)

El AK-101 es un rifle de asalto de la familia Kalashnikov diseñado para el mercado de exportación, utilizando cartuchos OTAN de 5.56x45 mm; el estándar de la mayoría de los países de la OTAN. El AK-101 se comercializa para aquellos que buscan un arma que combine la compatibilidad logística y la familiaridad de la munición de la OTAN de 5,56x45 mm con la fiabilidad de un Kalashnikov. Está diseñado con materiales modernos y compuestos, incluidos los plásticos para reducir el peso y mejorar la precisión. Many of the improvements found in the AK-101 are also present in the AK-103 and the rest of the AK-10x series of rifles.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech, EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ATG suppressor

The AK-102 is a 5.56x45mm carbine version of the AK-101 rifle. It features a shortened barrel that makes it a middle ground between a full rifle and the more compact AKS-74U. The rifle's receiver is made of stamped steel; magazine is made out of reinforced fibreglass and the stock is made of hollow plastic; making it lighter, more durable, and allowing a field kit to be stored inside of it.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech, EKP-8-02 Kobra, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ATG suppressor

The AK-103 assault rifle is a derivative of the AK-74M chambered for 7.62x39mm, same as the AKM and AK-47. The AK-103 can be fitted with a variety of sights including: laser, night vision, and telescopic sights, plus a suppressor and the GP-25 grenade launcher. It uses plastic components where ever possible instead of wood or metal to reduce weight.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ATG suppressor

The AK-104 is a 7.62x39mm carbine version of the AK-103 rifle. It features a shortened barrel that makes it a middle ground between a full rifle and the more compact AKS-74U. The rifle's receiver is made of stamped steel; the magazine is made out of reinforced fibreglass and the stock is made of hollow plastic, making it lighter, more durable, and allowing a field kit to be stored inside of it.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ATG suppressor

The AK-105 is a 5.45x39mm carbine version of the AK-74M rifle. The AK-105 is supplementing AKS-74U carbines in Russian Army service. Ideal for CQC (close quarters combat), it's not intended for long range combat. The rifle's reiver is made of stamped steel; the magazine is made out of reinforced fibreglass and the stock is made of hollow plastic, making it lighter, more durable, and allowing a field kit to be stored inside of it.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP 1S-03 "Kobra", 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor

El fusil de asalto Kalashnikov AK-12 es la creación más nueva de la fábrica IZMASH. Está destinado a reemplazar los fusiles Kalashnikov AK-74M y AK-100 más antiguos para uso doméstico, así como para la exportación. The rifle is a gas operated, selective fire rifle using traditional "Kalashnikov type" action with long stroke gas piston and rotary bolt locking. The bolt group is noticeably lightened to decrease recoil and improve accuracy in automatic fire.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor

El AK-74 es un rifle de asalto de 5.45x45 mm desarrollado a principios de la década de 1970 por Mikhail Kalashnikov para reemplazar al anterior AKM. Fue introducido en 1974 y vio por primera vez el servicio con las fuerzas soviéticas comprometidas en el Conflicto de Afganistán. The AKM rifle was adapted to fire smaller 5.45x45mm cartridge and fitted with a large muzzle brake.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor

El AK-74 es un rifle de asalto de 5.45x45 mm desarrollado a principios de la década de 1970 por Mikhail Kalashnikov para reemplazar al anterior AKM. Fue introducido en 1974 y vio por primera vez el servicio con las fuerzas soviéticas comprometidas en el Conflicto de Afganistán. The AKM rifle was adapted to fire smaller 5.45x45mm cartridge and fitted with a large muzzle brake. This particular model has an integrated EOTech holosight and a 45 round magazine. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EOTech sight (integrated)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor

El AK-74 es un rifle de asalto de 5.45x45 mm desarrollado a principios de la década de 1970 por Mikhail Kalashnikov para reemplazar al anterior AKM. Fue introducido en 1974 y vio por primera vez el servicio con las fuerzas soviéticas comprometidas en el Conflicto de Afganistán. The AKM rifle was adapted to fire smaller 5.45x45mm cartridge and fitted with a large muzzle brake. This particular variant was assembled a long time ago.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
%c[d_red] • %c[d_red] None due to the absence of a dovetail mount
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor

El AK-74 es un rifle de asalto de 5.45x45 mm desarrollado a principios de la década de 1970 por Mikhail Kalashnikov para reemplazar al anterior AKM. Fue introducido en 1974 y vio por primera vez el servicio con las fuerzas soviéticas comprometidas en el Conflicto de Afganistán. The AKM rifle was adapted to fire smaller 5.45x45mm cartridge and fitted with a large muzzle brake. This model seems to be very rusty and unreliable.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[d_red] mounting suppressor is not possible

En 1991, la fábrica Izhmash comenzó la producción de un AK-74 mejorado, el rifle de asalto AK-74M. Además de varias mejoras de producción menores, el rifle también presenta un nuevo material sintético plegable hecho de una poliamida negra rellena de vidrio. El AK-74M también usa un dispositivo de boca reforzado y una cubierta antipolvo. Cada AK-74M está equipado con un soporte de riel lateral para el montaje de la óptica. The AK-74M has been accepted as the new service rifle of the Russian Federation.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor

En 1991, la fábrica Izhmash comenzó la producción de un AK-74 mejorado, el rifle de asalto AK-74M. Además de varias mejoras de producción menores, el rifle también presenta un nuevo material sintético plegable hecho de una poliamida negra rellena de vidrio. El AK-74M también usa un dispositivo de boca reforzado y una cubierta antipolvo. Cada AK-74M está equipado con un soporte de riel lateral para el montaje de la óptica. El AK-74M ha sido aceptado como el nuevo rifle de servicio de la Federación Rusa. This model has a PK-A sight installed on the MTK-83 optical mount.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] PK-A red dot sight (integrated)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor

The AKS-74U was intended for use mainly by Spetsnaz units, airborne infantry, rear-echelon support units and armoured vehicle crews, who require a compact but relatively powerful individual automatic weapon. The AKS-74U is significantly more manoeuvrable in tight quarters than the AKS-74, but a significant decline in muzzle velocity resulted in a decrease in effective range.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] PBS-4 suppressor

The AKS-74U was intended for use mainly by Spetsnaz units, airborne infantry, rear-echelon support units and armoured vehicle crews, who require a compact but relatively powerful individual automatic weapon. The AKS-74U is significantly more manoeuvrable in tight quarters than the AKS-74, but a significant decline in muzzle velocity resulted in a decrease in effective range. This model seems to be very old.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
%c[d_red] • %c[d_red] None due to the absence of a dovetail mount
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] PBS-4 suppressor

The AKS-74U was intended for use mainly by Spetsnaz units, airborne infantry, rear-echelon support units and armoured vehicle crews, who require a compact but relatively powerful individual automatic weapon. The AKS-74U is significantly more manoeuvrable in tight quarters than the AKS-74, but a significant decline in muzzle velocity resulted in a decrease in effective range. This model has visible rust on it.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
%c[d_red] • %c[d_red] mounting suppressor is not possible

The AKS-74U was intended for use mainly by Spetsnaz units, airborne infantry, rear-echelon support units and armoured vehicle crews, who require a compact but relatively powerful individual automatic weapon. The AKS-74U is significantly more manoeuvrable in tight quarters than the AKS-74, but a significant decline in muzzle velocity resulted in a decrease in effective range. This special variant has a 45 round RPK magazine, an integrated Kobra sight and an integrated suppressor.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-1S-03 Kobra sight (integrated)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] PBS-4 suppressor (integrated)

The AKM is a 7.62x39mm assault rifle designed by Mikhail Kalashnikov. It is an improved version of the AK-47 rifle and was developed in the 1950's. Introduced to the Red Army in 1959, the AKM is the most ubiquitous variant of the AK series of firearms and it has found widespread use with the former Warsaw Pact states and its many African and Asian allies. The production of AKM rifles was carried out at the Tula Arsenal and Izhevsk Mechanical Works.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] PBS-1 suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)

Una variante del AKM, equipado con una pieza de hombro de metal que se dobla hacia abajo en lugar del material de madera fijo. The metal stock of the AKMS is somewhat different from the folding stock of the previous AK-47 model as it has a modified locking mechanism, which locks both support arms of the AKMS stock instead of just one.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] PBS-1 suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)

Una variante del AK-47, equipada con un soporte de hombro metálico plegable en lugar del material de madera fijo. It was designed for use inside armoured vehicles and by paratroopers.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] PBS-1 suppressor
%c[d_red] • %c[d_red] None due to the absence of a dovetail mount
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)

Un fusil más preciso y fiable que el AKM, el AK-74 todavía es utilizado por la mayoría de los países de la antigua URSS. The AKS-74 is the foldable stock version of AK-74 and its stock has a triangular shape and lacks the folding shoulder pad of the AKMS and is folded to the left side of the receiver.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor

Un fusil más preciso y fiable que el AKM, el AK-74 todavía es utilizado por la mayoría de los países de la antigua URSS. The AKS-74 is the foldable stock version of AK-74 and its stock has a triangular shape and lacks the folding shoulder pad of the AKMS and is folded to the left side of the receiver. This model is rusty and thus not very reliable.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher (after modification)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes
%c[d_red] • %c[d_red] mounting suppressor is not possible

The Stechkin APS is a Russian selective fire machine pistol, bearing the name of its designer Igor Stechkin. The Stechkin automatic pistol was originally chambered for 7.62x25mm Tokarev but was changed to the 9x18mm calibre used in the new Makarov pistol, as it became clear that this cartridge was set to become the new service ammunition for handguns in the Soviet Army. In 1951, both the Makarov and Stechkin were introduced into the Soviet military arsenal, replacing the ageing TT-33.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] APS suppressor

Steyr AUG A1 en configuración de rifle estándar (color verde militar). El AUG es un fusil de asalto bullpup austríaco de 5,56 mm, diseñado en la década de 1960 por Steyr Mannlicher GmbH & amp; Co KG (anteriormente Steyr-Daimler-Puch). The AUG (Armee-Universal-Gewehr "universal army rifle") was adopted by the Austrian Army as the StG 77 (Sturmgewehr 77) in 1978, where it replaced the 7.62mm StG 58 automatic rifle (a licence-built FN FAL). In production since 1978, it is the standard small arm of the Austrian Bundesheer and various national police units.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.56x45 compatible suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 1.5x scope (integrated).

Steyr AUG A1 en configuración de rifle estándar (color verde militar). El AUG es un fusil de asalto bullpup austríaco de 5,56 mm, diseñado en la década de 1960 por Steyr Mannlicher GmbH & amp; Co KG (anteriormente Steyr-Daimler-Puch). The AUG (Armee-Universal-Gewehr "universal army rifle") was adopted by the Austrian Army as the StG 77 (Sturmgewehr 77) in 1978, where it replaced the 7.62mm StG 58 automatic rifle (a licence-built FN FAL). In production since 1978, it is the standard small arm of the Austrian Bundesheer and various national police units. This model has been modified for usage of 7.62x51 NATO cartridge.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.56x45 compatible suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 1.5x scope (integrated).

El 92F es quizás mejor conocido como la pistola estándar del Ejército de los EE. UU., Reemplazando al legendario M1911. It is a short-recoil operated, locked-breech weapon with an aluminium frame and a hard chromed barrel bore. A popular sidearm adopted by several countries, it is especially popular among criminals for its high-powered rounds and high-capacity magazine.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 9x19 compatible suppressor (after modification)

El 92F es quizás mejor conocido como la pistola estándar del Ejército de los EE. UU., Reemplazando al legendario M1911. It is a short-recoil operated, locked-breech weapon with an aluminium frame and a hard chromed barrel bore. A popular sidearm adopted by several countries, it is especially popular among criminals for its high-powered rounds and high-capacity magazine. This model became rusty over time, resulting in low reliablity.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
%c[d_red] • %c[d_red] mounting suppressor is not possible

Esta ametralladora se ha desarrollado en Izhevsk en la famosa fábrica de armas del estado IZHMASH durante la década de 1990, y apareció por primera vez al público en 1993. Influenciado por las ametralladoras Calico, Bizon (Bison) SMG combinó la revista helicoidal de alta capacidad con apariencia más convencional y diseño. El Bizon está construido con receptores acortados AKS-74, hechos de acero estampado. Presentaba una acción de retroceso simple, un martillo disparado desde un cerrojo cerrado. The Bizon is capable of semi-automatic and automatic fire, with typical AK-type safety - selector lever on the right side of the receiver. Sights are similar to ones found on the AKS-74U, with hooded front post and flip up rear.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] EKP-8-02 Kobra, 1P29, PSO-1 scopes

A double-barrelled shotgun with shortened barrels. Más ligero y más compacto, efectivo a corta distancia. The CZ-75 was developed in the Czech Republic by the Koucky brothers. This semi-automatic pistol first appeared in 1975, entered production in 1976 and was intended for the export market. The CZ-75 accumulated the best features from many preceding designs and the resulting pistol was aesthetically attractive, comfortable to handle, shoot, accurate and reliable in operation. Made by CZ arms in various versions and modifications, the CZ-75 was also widely copied and cloned. The CZ-75 Auto is a 1995 model, boasting of a fully automatic fire mode and a longer barrel.

No one knows why IMI thought shooting a calibre of this size out of a handgun was a good idea, even though there are plenty of rounds out there that can do the job without breaking your wrist; this one assumes because of a pissing contest between the .44 and .50 AE. No solo es pesado y áspero en retroceso, también puedes usarlo para golpear a tus enemigos hasta matarlos por su tamaño y peso. Although militaries and law enforcement around the world, in their moment of sanity, never adopted this brick; Hollywood did, mostly because of its "cool factor" and now is the poster child for gangsters and pimps and a status symbol for those who reached a certain rank in a certain console shooter. Rumour is that there's a stalker with a crowbar wandering around the Zone with a rechambered version of this gun, but it's just a rumour.

Desde finales de la década de 1980 hasta principios de la década de 1990, FN Herstal comenzó a desarrollar un nuevo rifle. The Five-seveN is a delayed blowback operated, semi-automatic firearm. La pistola Five-seveN fue diseñada por FN Herstal como un arma complementaria para la ametralladora P90. El P90 y Five-seveN comparten la misma munición, el cartucho SS190 de 5.7x28 mm. The idea behind the ammunition and weapon is to provide good penetration against targets protected by body armour, while keeping the weapon's weight, dimensions and recoil at reasonable levels.

The FN FNP pistol is a series of semi-automatic, polymer framed pistols manufactured in Columbia, South Carolina by FNH USA, a division of Fabrique Nationale de Herstal. Debutó a principios de 2006, las armas de la serie FNP son armas disparadas con martillo que utilizan un sistema de cámara Browning con un extractor externo. El módulo disparador se encuentra dentro del marco de polímero como una unidad individual conectada al martillo. The magazine release button is held in place by a retention pin which can be removed to allow the button to be reversed.

The G3A3 is a battle rifle developed in the 1950s by the German arms manufacturer Heckler & Koch GmbH in collaboration with the Spanish state owned design and development agency CETME (Centro de Estudios Tecnicos de Materiales Especiales). Está diseñado para usar la munición de la OTAN de 7.62x51 mm y utiliza una acción de retroceso retardado por rodillos. El rifle debe su diseño al mod CETME. A, que fue diseñado por el ingeniero alemán Dr. Ludwig Vorgrimler. En 1957, Heckler & amp; Koch compró la licencia para fabricar el rifle, donde se hicieron pequeñas modificaciones al diseño de CETME. Oficialmente adoptado en servicio en 1959, por el Bundeswehr como el G3, permaneció en servicio hasta 1995, cuando fue reemplazado por el G36. Despite having been officially replaced by the German army, it is still in limited use.

The H&K G-36 was known as the HK-50 project in early 1990s. After the cancellation of the G11 and G41 projects, the Bundeswehr was left with outdated G3 rifles; Heckler & Koch was set to develop a new assault rifle for both the German army and for export. El nuevo rifle de asalto de 5.56x45 mm fue adoptado por la Bundeswehr en 1995 y también llegó a manos de varias agencias policiales de todo el mundo, incluida la policía británica y algunos departamentos de policía de los EE. UU. Hasta ahora, ha habido muy pocas quejas sobre este rifle. Los más comunes son el sobrecalentamiento de las esposas durante el fuego sostenido y la pérdida de cero en el alcance incorporado de los rifles G36KE. Algunos soldados alemanes también se quejaron de la posición de las miras ópticas duales y se empañaron fácilmente con mal tiempo. Otherwise, it is accurate, reliable and simple in maintenance.

FAMAS stands for Fusil d'Assaut de la Manufacture d'Armes de St-Etienne (Assault Rifle by St-Etienne Arms Factory). Development of this rifle began in 1967, by Paul Tellie, a French arms designer. This new rifle was intended to replace the ageing MAS Mle.49/56 semi-automatic rifles, MAT-49 submachine guns and MAC Mle.1929 light machine guns. The first FAMAS prototype had been built in 1971, and French military began to test this rifle in 1972. Meanwhile, France adopted a Swiss-designed SIG SG-540 5.56mm assault rifle as an intermediate solution. The FAMAS was adopted by the French in 1978 and since then became a standard French Army rifle, known among the French soldiers as "Le Clairon" (the bulge).

La Glock 19 es una versión más pequeña de la Glock 17. Su tamaño reducido hizo que la Glock 19 fuera más fácil de ocultar y llevar por las fuerzas militares y policiales. La pistola fue lanzada por Glock GbmH de Austria en 1988. En comparación con la Glock 17, la Glock 19 conserva el peso de su deslizamiento para mantener controlada la corta operación de retroceso mientras que al mismo tiempo acorta el agarre y el cañón. Muchos componentes de la Glock 19 se hicieron intercambiables con la Glock 17, incluida la revista. Simply put, the Glock 19 is a compact version of the 17.

The MP-443 is a short recoil operated, locked breech pistol that was developed for the Russian Army trials, codenamed "Grach" (rook). Estos ensayos se iniciaron mediante la emisión de los requisitos iniciales para una nueva pistola militar en 1993. Varios diseños se presentaron a los ensayos y el ganador fue la pistola diseñada en el estado de la Planta Mecánica de Izhevsk por Vladimir Yarygin. This pistol, initially known as the 6P35 military index during trials or the MP-443 "Grach" manufacturer's designation, is adopted by the Russian Government for military and law enforcement use under the PYa designation, and already issued to some Russian Army units.

The OTs-14 "Groza" ("Thunder") modular assault rifle was developed during the early 1990s at the TSKIB SOO. Estaba destinado a varias fuerzas especiales en el ejército ruso y el Ministerio de Asuntos Internos como un arma de guerra urbana dedicada. Briefly manufactured in small numbers at the Tula Arms factory during the mid-1990s, the OTs-14 saw action in Chechnya in 1999, but fell out of favour and are no longer being made. Es un diseño de bullpup, con un agarre extraíble que puede ser reemplazado por un lanzagranadas de 40 mm. Adoptado para las fuerzas de Spetsnaz y unidades de combate de primera línea especializadas, el OTs-14-4A permite el montaje de una de las cuatro versiones de armas, dependiendo de la misión. This Zone version is equipped with the GP-25 grenade launcher.

The GSh-18 is a 9x19mm semi-automatic pistol developed in the early 1990s at the KBP Instrument Design Bureau in Tula. The pistol's name is derived from its designers - Gryazev and Shipunow, and the number 18 denotes the magazine capacity. El GSh-18 es una pistola de cerradura bloqueada y accionada por retroceso. El arma tiene un cañón inusual girado por leva con 10 orejetas de bloqueo. El GSh-18 tiene un gatillo disparado y presenta un gatillo preestablecido que precede a la pistola cuando la diapositiva retrocede después de disparar un tiro, el percutor se amartilla completamente tirando del gatillo hacia atrás. With the 7N21 and 7N31 armour-piercing bullets, it can pierce 8mm of steel at 20 meters.

El HK416 es un rifle diseñado y fabricado por Heckler & amp; Koch para mejorar el M4. Está disponible como un arma de fuego completa, o como un receptor superior que se adapta a cualquier receptor inferior de tipo AR-15. The US Army's Delta Force collaborated with the German arms makers to develop the new rifle. La prueba del H & amp; K 416 en 2004 reveló que el sistema operativo de pistón reduce significativamente las disfunciones y aumenta la vida útil de las piezas. The project was originally called the H&K M4, but was changed in response to a trademark infringement suit filed by Colt Defence. Currently, it is only available to government and military organisations, hence why this assault rifle is usually carried by Mercenaries.

The Browning Hi-Power is a single-action, 9mm semi-automatic pistol. Está basado en las ideas del inventor estadounidense de armas de fuego John Browning, creado y patentado en 1922, luego patentado por FN Herstal. Browning murió en 1926, antes de que terminara de desarrollar una versión de producción, pero la diseñadora de armas FN Dieudonne Saive la desarrolló por completo. La pistola Hi-Power se destacó por su capacidad de 13 cartuchos redondos, el doble de diseños contemporáneos como el Luger o el Mauser 1910. This modified variant of the Browning HP pistol, despite its venerable age, enjoys popularity around the world.

The M16 is the U.S. military designation for a family of rifles derived from the ArmaLite AR-15 and further developed by Colt starting in the 1960s. La familia de rifles M16, incluidos los M16/A1/A2/A3/A4 ha sido el fusil de infantería principal del ejército de los Estados Unidos desde la década de 1960. With its variants, it has been in use by 15 NATO countries, and is the most produced firearm in its calibre. The M16 is a lightweight, 5.56x45mm calibre, air cooled, gas operated, magazine fed assault rifle, with a rotating bolt, actuated by direct impingement gas operation. The rifle is made of steel, aluminium, and composite plastics.

El rifle M16A2 entró en servicio en la década de 1980, equipado para disparar la munición estándar de la OTAN, el cartucho M855/M856 de diseño belga. El M16A2 es un rifle de tiro selecto, que incorpora elementos de diseño solicitados por la Infantería de Marina: una mira trasera ajustable, con amortiguación, mayor longitud, cañón más pesado, deflector de caja para los tiradores de la izquierda y guardamanos cilíndricos. The M16A2 is manufactured by Colt and the Fabrique Nationale de Herstal arms company, with the variant rifles made elsewhere in the world.

La M249 es una ametralladora de 5.56x45 con correa. Es la adaptación estadounidense del belga FN Minimi. El M249 ha visto acción en todos los conflictos importantes que involucran a los Estados Unidos desde la invasión estadounidense a Panamá en 1989. Soldiers are generally satisfied with the weapon's performance, though there have been reports of clogging with dirt and sand.

La carabina M4 desciende de una familia de armas de fuego que remonta su linaje a versiones anteriores de carabina del M16, todas basadas en el AR-15 original fabricado por ArmaLite. Es una versión más corta y ligera del rifle de asalto M16, que comparte el 80% de sus piezas. El M4 dispara municiones de la OTAN de 5.56x45mm y son armas de fuego selectivas operadas por gas, refrigeradas por aire, alimentadas por una revista, con una reserva telescópica de 4 posiciones. Al igual que con muchas carabinas, el M4 es práctico y más conveniente de llevar que un rifle de longitud completa. Ha sido adoptado por el Comando de Operaciones Especiales de los Estados Unidos (USSOCOM) y es el arma preferida de las Fuerzas Especiales del Ejército de los EE. UU. It has been adopted by United States Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) and is the preferred weapon of the U.S. Army Special Forces and Navy SEALs.

The M4A1 is a modified variant of the M4 carbine able to fire automatic or semi-automatic.

The Barrett M98B is a bolt-action sniper rifle chambered in .338 Lapua Mag. Rather than modifying a hunting rifle, Barrett created an original design for the M98B. The M98B features an adjustable stock and cheek pad for comfort, an adjustable trigger for preferable trigger control, a rear monopod and a front bi-pod for stability. Users can further modify the rifle by attaching sights, lights and grips to its rails. The M98B has a simple design making it easy for users to disassemble and clean.

Una versión básica del Mosin-Nagant con interiores ligeramente desgastados. El M1891/30 fue producido para la edición estándar para toda la infantería soviética de 1930 a 1945. It was extremely successful in World War II as a sniper rifle when it was equipped with a 4x PE or a 3.5x PU scope.

Mossberg 590 fue desarrollado por O.F.Mossberg & amp; la compañía de sus hijos durante la década de 1970 en los EE. UU. como una modificación de la escopeta Mossberg modelo 500 para su adopción por el ejército de los EE. Modifications included strengthening of the receiver, installation of the vented heatshield around the barrel, a bayonet lug and extended magazine and an aluminium trigger guard instead of plastic one. Standard finish is Parkerizing, and the gun is provided with replacement pistol grip, which allows easy conversion to 'Cruiser' modification. Since 1987, this was the standard shotgun of US Armed forces; officially replaced in US Army with Benelli M1014 semi-automatic shotgun, Mossberg 590 shotguns are still used by US Navy and US Marine Corp.\n \n

El MP-133 es un producto de la Planta Mecánica de Izhevsk. Esta escopeta es una evolución de la anterior escopeta de acción de bomba IZH-81, y está destinada a los mercados civiles y de seguridad. Se produce en dos versiones básicas: It is produced in two basic versions: standard MP-133 with tubular magazine and MP-133K with detachable box magazine, both versions can be in various barrel lengths and styles, wood or polymer furniture, fixed or side folding polymer stock or pistol grip only. La escopeta MP-133 usa una acción de bomba tradicional con una barra deslizante que tiene barras de doble acción. El bloqueo se logra mediante una pieza de bloqueo inclinable, instalada en el perno y se acopla a la muesca en la extensión del cañón cuando está en la batería. Feed is from tubular underbarrel magazine that holds 4 rounds, though capacity can be enhanced by installing magazine extension tubes.\n \n

The MP-153 self-loading shotgun was the first semi-automatic shotgun designed and manufactured by Izhevsk Mechanical Plant. Fue desarrollado junto con la pistola de acción MP-133 y comparte muchas partes y ensambles con ella. The MP-153 is one of the most popular semi-automatic shotguns of Russian origin, and is widely used to hunt various games in Russia. It is also sold for export, it is known as Remington "Spartan" SPR-453 autoloader in US. MP-153 shotguns are known for solid but somewhat heavy construction and reliability.\n \n

El MP412 REX es un revólver ruso de acción doble .357 con una cámara de acción rápida y un eyector automático. Fue diseñado para la exportación (REX, Revolver for EXport), pero nunca se puso en producción debido a la falta de un mercado. El arma fue diseñada por IZHMECH, la planta mecánica rusa Izhevsk Mechanical Plant, que también diseñó y produjo la pistola semiautomática Makarov PM.

El MP5 es una de las armas de fuego más famosas y extendidas de su clase. The MP5's compactness, accuracy and reliability have made it a favourite of numerous military, law enforcement, intelligence and security organisations the world over. El MP5A3 está equipado con un material de metal retráctil. Not surprisingly, having flooded the global black markets, it eventually made its way to the Zone.

OTs-33 "Pernach" (Russian for multivaned mace) is a recent entry into the small class of Russian automatic pistols. El Pernach fue desarrollado en 1995 para reemplazar la pistola Stechkin APS en unidades especiales paramilitares. The FN P90 submachine gun was developed in the late 1980s as a personal defence weapon for troops whose primary activities does not include small arms, such as vehicle and tank crew members, artillery crews etc. Standard pistols and submachine guns were proven ineffective against enemies wearing body armour. FN designers developed a new round, initially designated as SS90, to achieve high penetration while keeping recoil low FN used a small-bore approach, creating a round that looked like the scaled down 5.56 NATO round. The result was FN P90 personal defence weapon, introduced in 1990 along with improved 5.7x28 SS190 ammunition which replaced polymer cored bullets with heavier dual core, steel and aluminium, bullets for better penetration against body armour.

El PB (Pistolet Besshumnyj o Pistola silenciosa), también conocido en el ejército soviético como 6P9, se desarrolló en 1967 para las unidades Spetsnaz del ejército soviético, así como para los operativos de la KGB. La pistola se basa en una pistola modificada Makarov PM y presenta un único Silenciador integral de dos piezas. Emitido en servicio en 1967, el PB (índice GRAU 6P9) es una pistola silenciada soviética basada en el PM de Makarov. Estaba destinado a ser utilizado por el KGB y los grupos de reconocimiento del ejército. La parte frontal del Silenciador es desmontable, por lo que la pistola se puede dividir en dos partes para un transporte conveniente. The PB's integral suppressor also reduces the bullet velocity to below subsonic levels.

The PKP "Pecheneg" is a Russian light machine gun chambered for the 7.62x54mmR round. It is a modernised PKM machine gun. The Pecheneg is said to be more accurate than all its predecessors due to a heavier, non-removable, forced air cooling barrel with radial cooling ribs and a handle which eliminates the haze effect from hot gases and keeps the barrel cooler, making the weapon more reliable.\n \n
An ancient PM given to Degtyarev as a reward for "Successful execution of highly dangerous state orders, as well as valour and courage shown in the line of duty".

This Soviet legacy is the most common pistol in the Zone and is one of the best compact self-defence handguns available. Es pequeño, altamente fiable, fácil de usar y mantener en funcionamiento. También adolece de varios inconvenientes, incluidos el corto alcance, la baja precisión de disparo y la escasa potencia de frenado, y también la pérdida de las pistolas modernas de su clase en términos de peso y tamaño de revista. En 1951, la pistola Makarova fue seleccionada por su simplicidad, fácil fabricación, precisión y un poder de frenado razonable.

The most widely known variant, the Makarov PMM was a redesign of the original gun. In 1990 a group of engineers reworked the original Makarov, primarily by increasing the load for the cartridge. The result is 25% more gas pressure increasing in muzzle velocity. The PMM magazine holds 12 rounds, compared to the PM's 8 rounds.

The PP-2000 is the latest development of the Instrument Design Bureau (KBP) from Tula, Russia. Expuesta por primera vez al público en 2004, la patente para su diseño se presentó en 2001 y se emitió en 2003. The niche for the PP-2000 is a personal defence weapon for non-infantry military personnel, as well as close combat weapon for special forces and special law enforcement teams. Como tal, es un arma compacta con pocas piezas de fiabilidad, mantenimiento simplificado y bajo costo. Best suited for close combat.

Una importante arma de infantería de las fuerzas armadas soviéticas durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial, el PPSh-41 era un arma duradera, de bajo mantenimiento, hecha de componentes baratos y de fácil obtención. They utilise 7.62x25mm cartridge.\n \n

Armsel Protecta, de diseño único, es una escopeta giratoria de 12 gags, desarrollada para el control de disturbios y el combate. Anticuado ahora por la Saiga-12 rusa y la American AA-12, la Protecta fue un arma revolucionaria creada por el gobierno del Apartheid en la década de 1980. This smoothbore combat revolver-type shotgun was intended to provide extreme firepower for militarised units. El arma se beneficia de una gran revista y una alta tasa de fuego efectiva, pero su volumen y peso considerable, combinado con un largo tiempo de recarga, son el precio a pagar por estas ventajas. Raras en la Zona y se usan principalmente para despejar espacios confinados de mutantes. Specifically this variant is highly modernised, details inside are tightly fit to each other, muzzle energy is increased significantly thanks to higher pressure in the gun barrel. Sacrificing rate of fire, stopping power is increased. This model has Aimpoint AB collimator sight made by Swedish company.

El RG-6 (índice 6G30) estaba en desarrollo entre 1993 y 1994 por TSKIB SOO. The new stand-alone, rapid-firing multi-shot launcher was required to increase the firepower of the infantry during the urban combat, due to recent small scale conflicts, such as the Chechen Wars. El RG-6 entró en producción limitada a mediados de la década de 1990 y ahora es utilizado por varios elementos del ejército ruso y las fuerzas especiales, así como por fuerzas especiales en el Ministerio de Asuntos Internos (MVD). El RG-6 está diseñado para disparar todas las granadas estándar sin cassette de 40 mm, disponibles para lanzadores antibarro de edición general, como GP-25 y GP-30. These rounds include VOG-25 fragmentation grenade, VOG-25P bouncing fragmentation grenade and "Gvozd" (Nail) nonlethal tear gas grenade for riot control. El tambor también se carga frontalmente. Ampliamente utilizado para la supresión rápida de las posiciones de tiro enemigas y, cuando está al aire libre, atacando objetivos fijos defendidos o combatiendo mutantes particularmente duros.

Equipado con una culata de esqueleto de madera, así como una culata con bisagras y una empuñadura de pistola de madera. La parte trasera de la culata alberga un kit de limpieza, y una varilla de limpieza desmontada se almacena en la pierna derecha del bípode. A very reliable machine gun.\n \n
La RPD (ametralladora de mano Degtyaryov) es una ametralladora ligera desarrollada en la Unión Soviética por Vasily Degtyaryov para el cartucho intermedio M62 de 7.62x39 mm.

El RPG-7 es un desarrollo posterior del lanzagranadas antitanque RPG-2 anterior. El RPG-7, en su primera versión, conocido como RPG-7V, ha sido adoptado por el ejército soviético en 1961, y todavía se encuentra en Rusia y al menos en 50 países más. Por mucho, el RPG-7 puede considerarse como uno de los lanzadores de granadas antitanque más exitosos que se hayan fabricado. Initially thought of as an anti-armour weapon, it was later adopted for other fire support missions with the introduction of other types of grenades, such as anti-infantry HE-FRAG and multi-purpose Thermobaric/FAE. El RPG-7 es un lanzacohetes sin retroceso de un solo disparo, lanzado desde el hombro, las granadas se cargan desde la parte delantera y la parte trasera del cañón está equipada con una boquilla venturi. Debido al diseño sin retroceso, el backblast es peligroso. El RPG-7 generalmente se emite con una mira óptica de 2.7 aumentos fijos, designada PGO-7. Es simple y de bajo costo, pero posee una gran amenaza para los tanques modernos y también puede servir en una serie de otras funciones, por lo que es un arma flexible.

The RPK is a Soviet light machine gun, developed by Mikhail Kalashnikov in 1961 based on the Kalashnikov assault rifle. Created as part of Soviet efforts to standardise the armoury of the Red Army, the RPK replaced the RPD and is still in use to present day.\n \n

La RPK (Ruchnoy Pulemyot Kalashnikova o ametralladora de mano Kalashnikov) es una ametralladora ligera de 5.45x45 mm, desarrollada por Mikhail Kalashnikov a fines de la década de 1950. It was created as part of a program designed to standardise the small arms inventory of the Red Army, where it replaced the 7.62x39mm RPD light machine gun. Hoy, el RPK continúa siendo utilizado por las fuerzas armadas de los países de la antigua Unión Soviética y ciertas naciones africanas y asiáticas. El ejército polaco adoptó el arma en 1974, donde se usa en unidades de asalto, reconocimiento y operaciones especiales en el aire. The RPK was also manufactured under license in Bulgaria and Romania.

El SPAS-12 es una escopeta de modo dual, diseñada para el combate y las medidas antidisturbios. Es empleado por muchas unidades militares y policiales especiales en todo el mundo. Con su característico escudo de calor y material plegable, el SPAS-12 es un arma de fuego icónica. Notable por su fiabilidad y flexibilidad táctica. An army shotgun designed specifically for assault units and created on the basis of the Franchi SPAS-12. The SR-25, Stoner Rifle, model 25 was developed by Reed Knight, owner of Knights Armament Co. and Eugene Stoner. The SR-25 is an AR-15 rifle scaled up to shoot 7.62x51mm NATO or .308 ammunition. 60% of parts in the rifle is interchangeable with AR-15 components. This rifle sold well among civilian shooters who needed an accurate semi-automatic rifle in 7.62x51mm NATO or .308 calibre for hunting or target shooting. This rifle also found a favour in US Military. All rifles built on the SR-25 platform share the same basic action, the AR-15/M16 system. Because of AR-15 style recoil buffer, which extends rearwards from the receiver, SR-25 cannot be fitted with a folding stock instead it is fitted with telescoping stock.

La TOZ-194 es una escopeta de acción de bomba de calibre 12 fabricada por la fábrica de armas Tula. Designed during the last years of the Soviet Union, the manufacture of this firearm has started after its collapse, and since then it has gained a certain popularity within civilian shooters in Russia and in Europe and is reported to be in use with some Russian Security forces.\n \n

Destinado a la caza profesional y aficionada, el TOZ-34 es una escopeta superior/inferior. Aunque carece de capacidad, solo 2 Munición, se compara bien con las escopetas de alto grado debido a su alta precisión de golpes. La TOZ 34 fue diseñada por N. I. Korovyakov y V. P. Ochnev en 1965. A un precio asequible, con un alto rendimiento de daños y su capacidad de descargar ambas Munición, la convierte instantáneamente en un arma popular entre los novatos en las afueras de la Zona. Especially useful against mutants thanks to its accuracy and stopping power.\n \n

Hand made modification of TOZ-34 that uses only specially made "Bull" ammunition that could probably stop a tank. Modifications are mostly related to the strength of the gun, and at a first glance, it looks simply like a decorated TOZ-34. But when you take a closer look, you can see that barrel is made from a unique metal, betraying its non-standard origin, and the stock is also made from some type of carbon fibre, inscribed with the letter "F". It's hard to tell who made it and how it ended up in the Zone... \n \n%c[ui_gray_2]

The UMP was developed by H&K in the 1990s, first appearing on the market in 1999. The idea behind the UMP was to create lightweight and powerful submachine gun, that was also cheaper than the MP5. El UMP, destinado principalmente a la aplicación de la ley en los EE. UU., Apareció en .45ACP y .40SW, y luego en 9 mm. Al proporcionar una mayor potencia de frenado que el MP5, el UMP45 también produce más retroceso. Esto hace que controlar el fuego automático completo sea más difícil. The UMP45's cyclic rate of fire was lowered significantly to combat this problem.

Originally designed for the American market, the USP, Universal Self loading Pistol, is known as an accurate and reliable handgun. Proporcionaron gran parte de los criterios de diseño para el USP. Los controles son exclusivamente estadounidenses, influenciados por diseños famosos como la pistola Government Model 1911. All USPs use a fibre-reinforced polymer frame stiffened by stainless steel inserts at areas subject to stress and friction. Incorporating several successful handgun design elements, the USP Compact .45 is a part of the USP family of handguns designed by H&K. Able to withstand extreme punishment and adverse conditions, it is used by several countries' police and special forces units.

The AS Val is widely used by Russian Army recon units, as well as by MVD (Internal Affairs Ministry) and FSB (Federal Security Bureau) Special Forces. El TT-33 es una pistola rusa de 7.62x25 mm. Fue desarrollado a principios de la década de 1930 por Fedor Tokarev como una pistola de servicio para el ejército soviético para reemplazar el revólver Nagant M1895. Muchos países del bloque comunista o soviético hicieron una variación de la pistola TT-33, hasta que finalmente fue reemplazado por 9x18mm Makarov PM en 1952. La producción del TT-33 en la URSS terminó en 1954.

Un arma desconocida, cuyo mecanismo de disparo no ha sido establecido. The weapon appears faulty - squeezing the trigger doesn't do anything. It's very heavy and definitely high-tech. Es de destacar que parece no disparar balas en función de la ignición. Lo más probable es que las Munición estén impulsadas por fuerzas electromagnéticas. Uno solo puede sospechar qué clase de potencial destructivo posee.

The ASh-12.7 (-12.7, which stands for " 12.7" or "Automatic assault rifle, 12.7mm") battle rifle is a dedicated CQB/Urban Operations weapon, developed by TsKIB SOO ("Central Design and Research Bureau of Sporting and Hunting Arms"), a subsidiary of the KBP Instrument Design Bureau of Tula, Russia, by request from the Russian FSB (Federal Security Service). The weapon was designed with extreme short-range stopping power in mind because it is intended for special units of the FSB which operate in urban environments against heavily armed and organized gangsters and terrorists who need to be killed in one shot. According to the Russian press, the first batch of ASh-12.7 assault rifles was delivered to the FSB.

The APB (Avtomaticheskij Pistolet Besshumnyj – automatic silenced pistol) is a further development of the Stechkin APS automatic pistol. APB has been developed by 1972 for Soviet Spetsnaz and KGB units, and has been widely used in Afghanistan and later conflicts. All APB pistols were reworked from earlier Stechkin APS pistols. The APB, with the silencer fitted, is as loud as a non-silenced .22 caliber pistol, and is very accurate and controllable, especially with the shoulder stock fitted.\n \n

The CZ 52 (also known by the Czechoslovak military designations vz. 52, for (vz. - vzor = model) "model of 1952", and CZ 482) is a semi-automatic pistol designed by two brothers, Jan and Jaroslav Kratochvil, in the early 1950s for the Czechoslovak military. Around 200,000 vz. 52s were made by Ceska Zbrojovka in Strakonice from 1952 to 1954. Before standardizing on the 7.62?25mm vz. 52, the Czechoslovak military used several domestic and foreign pistol models in three different calibers.\n \n

The FNC (Fabrique Nationale Carabine) is a 5.56?45mm NATO assault rifle developed by the Belgian arms manufacturer FN Herstal and introduced in the late 1970s.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.56x45 compatible suppressor

The Heckler & Koch HK417 is a battle rifle designed and manufactured by Heckler & Koch in Germany. It is the larger caliber version of the HK416, and chambered for the full-power 7.62?51mm NATO rifle cartridge. It is a gas-operated, selective fire rifle with a rotating bolt. The HK417 is intended for use in roles where the greater penetrative power, stopping power, and range of the 7.62?51mm cartridge are required. It has been adopted for service by a number of armed forces, special forces, and police organizations.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.56x45 compatible suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, EOTech scopes

The M60, officially the United States Machine Gun, Caliber 7.62 mm, M60, is a family of American general-purpose machine guns firing 7.62?51mm NATO cartridges from a disintegrating belt of M13 links. There are several types of ammunition approved for use in the M60, including ball, tracer, and armor-piercing rounds.\n \n

The Heckler & Koch MP7 (Maschinenpistole 7) is a German personal defence weapon (PDW) designed and manufactured by Heckler & Koch (H&K) and chambered for the HK 4.6?30mm cartridge. It was designed with the new cartridge to meet NATO requirements published in 1989, as these requirements call for a personal defense weapon (PDW) class firearm, with a greater ability to penetrate body armor than current weapons limited to conventional pistol cartridges. The MP7 went into production in 2001.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 9x19 compatible suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, C-more Railway Tactical, EOTech scopes

The XM8 is a lightweight assault rifle system from the late 1990s to early 2000s. The rifle was designed by German small arms manufacturer Heckler & Koch (H&K), and shares design and engineering with their G36 rifle.
 The XM8 design was originally part of the Objective Individual Combat Weapon program (OICW), which was developing a "smart" grenade launcher system with an underslung carbine rifle. The system was unable to meet performance and weight requirements and was eventually canceled. In the aftermath, the two portions of the OICW were separated, resulting in the XM8 and XM25 projects.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 5.56x45 compatible suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, C-more Railway Tactical, EOTech scopes

Una granada de humo de mano. Se usa para colocar pantallas de humo. Una vez que se lanza la granada, la pantalla de humo tarda 10 segundos en expandirse.

An incendiary grenade (or thermite grenade) that produces intense heat (2,200 C or 3,992 F) by means of a chemical reaction in which powdered aluminium and iron oxide react to produce a stream of molten iron and aluminium oxide. Filled with 600 to 800 grams of thermite.

\n \n%c[ui_gray_1]A large hunting knife with a rugged rubber handle. Sharp y bien mantenido. It might not be good at penetrating combat armours but due to the toothed blade it is ideal at causing massive, bleeding wounds to open flesh. This is makes it a perfect choice when confronting animals, especially when finishing off already wounded ones.

%c[ui_gray_1]Soviet bayonet designed for the AK rifles. It is highly durable, but not particularly capable of anything else than thrusting.
 
 %c[d_red] • %c[d_red] unsuitable for chopping thick-skinned mutants

\n \n%c[ui_gray_1]A very durable hunting knife with a large blade of stainless steel. Ideal para manipular animales más grandes, carne y pieles gruesas. Puede causar heridas masivas y sangrantes. Its draw-back is that it does not pierce heavy armours with adequate effectiveness.

%c[ui_gray_1]This Soviet steel knife has a 152 mm blade with a clip point, a large choil, a black wooden handle, and an S-shaped guard. The guard is "inverted" because standard Soviet Army grips called for holding the knife with the edge towards yourself. The handle is enforced with rugged fabric for a good grip. The knife is relatively small, which does not allow it to produce deep or heavy wounds, however it is specifically designed to bypass modern combat armours.
 
 %c[d_red] • %c[d_red] unsuitable for chopping thick-skinned mutants.

\n \n%c[ui_gray_1]A rare Soviet military knife of high historic and symbolic value. Decorated with an iron emblem of a certain World War II parachute division on the wooden handle. Any stalker in possession of one of these, be it novice or veteran, is highly respected anywhere in the Zone and especially within his faction. Usually awarded for exceptional performance during missions, for example for saving a faction leader from the certain death.

A well-kept Spetsnaz military knife ideal for recon class soldiers. Spetsnaz units reportedly used it to slit throats of MRBM launching sites crews few days prior to planned massive nuclear exchange in European operational theater. It is a deadly weapon and the only knife in the Zone that is relatively good at both piercing armours and dealing massive tissue damage. Ultimate melee weapon.

Un hacha (o hacha) es un implemento que se ha utilizado durante milenios para dar forma, dividir y cortar madera, para cosechar madera, como arma y como símbolo ceremonial o heráldico. El hacha tiene muchas formas, pero generalmente consiste en una cabeza de hacha con mango o helve. In the Zone, the axe can ensure your survival thanks to its versatility.
 
 %c[ui_gray_1]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] melee weapon
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] everyday item
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] not suitable for harvesting mutant parts

Most commonly employed by firefighters, this heavy axe is often used by stalkers for felling trees, or, like all great things, repurposed for hacking apart one's enemies, living or dead. Thus, it can serve as a formidable weapon in the hands of a skilled stalker.

 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] everyday item
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] not suitable for harvesting mutant parts

Used for thousands of years for cutting wood, hacking flesh, and even as a ceremonial object, this convenient axe comes in many shapes, though always consisting of a cleaver and handle. In a place like the Zone, this axe can mean both life and death.

The M68 lightweight grenade packs a considerable amount of shrapnel and is popular among paratroopers, marines and special NATO forces. Fitted with the M213 fuse, it can be worn and rapidly deployed by hooking the trigger lever to the equipment belt.
A home-made flamethrower, prone to jamming and having poor range. Its haphazard design suggests it was made in the zone by a disturbed stalker.
